grahampaige.comment: And after listening to all this great information from Dr Acuff about how we're going forward with these different things, I'm very pleased at what he has said tonight. So thank you again, Doctor. It was really good hearing everything. But now back down here where I am, so I'll go ahead and make sure everybody knows who they can call if there were any questions later because some people may not know me yet since I've only lived out here two months ago but anyway, Graham Page County Line District Representative. If anyone needs anything else just give us a holler anytime day night weekend doesn't matter. We don't care when you want something done. Just let us hear from ya. Thanks everyone. Goodnight. Motion passed by consent agenda motion carried unanimously. All motions made during closed session held electronically through Zoom meeting software pursuant to Virginia State Law Section eleven dash fifty eight point three subsection sixteen authorizes public bodies to meet by electronic communication means due to certain declared states emergency situations which include pandemic flu epidemics emergencies judged likely infectious disease outbreaks actual infectious disease outbreak declarations of local emergency hazardous weather conditions natural disaster high volumes absenteeism among delegates or performing officers upon certification by office holders identified in section fifteen dash twenty five slash zero six dot four B seven C of code of Virginia applicable minority student advisory committee meetings shall also comply fully with provisions set forth in Virginia Freedom Information Act otherwise known as FOIA throughout such authorization period unless ended sooner terminated date given notice sixty minutes prior thereto being read into minute record accordingly certified recording clerk reading roll call per Mr Katina Johnston seconded Miss Colson approved by unanimous approval Mrs Johnson seconds moved by Mr Oberg approve by acclamation next order business new business first item number nine dash one update regarding COVID nineteen mitigation strategies within Albemarle county public schools presented by doctor Kate Ackoff associate superintendent chief operating officer Kate Akov. Hello evening chair page vice-chair Carlson dr acoustic Katrina colston miss del caro mr oberman mister alcoff ms osborn along with other staff presenters today including deputy superintendent deborah collins assistant superintendents patrick McLaughlin Dan Callahan director of health services Rosalyn Schmitt plus many others behind them working diligently every single week providing updates around various aspects related to mitigating transmission risk associated with SARS-CoV-two virus causing global pandemic named coronavirus disease twenty-nineteen abbreviated commonly referred to simply as Covid Nineteen. Tonight presentation focuses primarily on current status operational adjustments moving
